pullRequest.body:
`card_sigma` existed for `Fintype.card` and I've added it for `Nat.card`. This version uses `Finite` instead of `Fintype` for the dependent type, for generality.

`card_univ` existed for `Nat.card` and I've added it for `Fintype.card`.

I've added `card_subtype_true` for both `Nat.card` and `Fintype.card`.

I've renamed `empty_card` -> `card_empty`

With `Fintype.card` rewrite lemmas, one has to be careful about the instance to avoid unifying with a non-defeq instance. This can be solved by taking the instance as a (normal) implicit parameter. However, it is not clear that this is really necessary.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

</details>

#### Declarations diff

`+ Fintype.card_subtype_true`
`+ card_sigma`
`+ card_subtype_true`
`++ card_empty`
`++-- empty_card`
`- empty_card'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13217184315/job/36897805500)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13217184315/job/36897805397)

```suggestion
theorem Fintype.card_setUniv [Fintype Î±] {_ : Fintype (Set.univ : Set Î±)} :
```

```suggestion
    Fintype.card (Set.univ : Set Î±) = Fintype.card Î± := by
```

I wrote the theorem with the `Fintype (Set.univ : Set Î±)` hypothesis, which is unecessary, (as it can use `[Fintype Î±]` to infer it). The reason is that the lemma would fire irrespective of the particular instance that is in place, and without needing to unify the instance. So I think it is better to explicitly write the application `@Fintype.card .. h`, to make sure lean doesn't accidentally use the other instance that is available. Do you agree?
That's reasonable, yes. But can you explain that in a comment to avoid your lemma being regolfed?

You mentioned the "would fire irrespective of the particular instance that is in place" part, which is apolemical, but not the "explicitly write the application @Fintype.card .. h, to make sure lean doesn't accidentally use the other instance that is available" part, which I disagree with (Lean always infers from local instances before doing any non-trivial typeclass search)
So how would you suggest it?
Either the suggestion I made above or some wording of your choice
... and then you can revert this

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: missing basic API lemmas for `Nat.card`, `Fintype.card`
